results.title: East Timor: birth of a nation
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Luigi Acquisto, Stella Zammataro and Andrew Sully
results.brief_description: In 1974 after 460 years of Portuguese rule, Fretilin, the revolutionary front for an independent East Timor, declared independence in the small nation. Ten days later Indonesia invaded. Fretilin and the resistance army fought the Indonesian military over the next 24 years, with over 250,000 people dying as a result of the occupation. In 1999, the East Timorese people voted overwhelmingly for independence, but as the Indonesian army and local militia withdrew, chaos ensued, razing the country to the ground. This two-part documentary recounts incredible stories from East Timor after the country is reborn as an independent nation. Episode one: Rosas story is about a young widow and mother of six, living in abject poverty with her children scattered in various orphanages. She saves for the fare to reunite her family for the first time expressing her hope for their future. Episode two: Lu Olos story is about a man who survived twenty years in the armed resistance. Having accepted an elevated rank, Lu Olo faces the difficulties in transitioning from guerilla fighter to politician.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Luigi Acquisto, Stella Zammataro and Andrew Sully

results.title: East side story : the story of Soviet musicals
results.brief_description: The Iron Curtain countries were not known for their joie de vivre, but between the cracks of stark socialist realism, there somehow appeared a few films that offered their audiences escape, hope and hit songs. With lots of colourful clips from singing pig farmers, dancing sailors, happy housewives, socialist summer vacations, the cinderella factory girl and of course the singing tractor-drivers, this moving, hilarious and courageous story is thoughtfully told by the filmmakers and actors themselves.

results.title: East of the moon. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Grasshopper, Sianel 4 Cymru, Sudwestfunk, Joy Whitby and Marc Evans
results.brief_description: The witch and the rainbow cat is the story of Rose, a young girl on an outing to the country with her parents. Rose enters a mysterious wood in which she discovers a strange little house full of bric-a-brac and curiosities. A stuffed cat watches her as she sees her reflection in a mirror which shows her what she will look like in the future. When the owner of the house arrives - a wizened old witch - she is told that she will have to be the witch’s servant for the rest of her life. The stuffed cat comes to life and offers to help Rose if she can solve a riddle. She manages to escape and rejoins her parents who laugh at her story. “The sea tiger” is the story of a tiger who tells the most outrageous lies and how his animal friends in the jungle try to put a stop to it. This video also includes the song “Think before you speak”, written by Neil Innes.

results.title: East of the moon. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Based on the Terry Jones fairytales and contains two wonderful stories: “The Island of purple fruits”: A shipwrecked sailor finds a magical tree and when he eats the fruit, he dreams wonderful dreams. One day, when he is an old man he is rescued and returns home. He agrees with his wife that his dreams were not really good dreams because they didn’t include his family who remained unhappy during his absence. “The Fly-by-night”: A strange Peter Pan-like creature who rides on the back of a giant cat, taps on a girl’s window and invites her to fly with him into the skies. They visit a magical night club in the sky and are entertained by a chorus of stars. When the girl awakes, she wonders if it was a dream or not and longs for the fly-by-night to come tapping on her window again, but he never does.

results.title: East of Eden
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description: It is 1917, just before the United States’ entry into World War I and two brothers are graduating from High School at a time of great social change. James Dean gives a powerful performance as Cal, rebelling against his farmer father and slowly coming to grips with the secrets and betrayals his family have kept from him. Using biblical metaphors and Freudian symbolism Kazan delivers a hard-hitting and emotionally intense drama based on the latter half of John Steinbeck’s novel. Though Dean’s performance as the psychologically scarred son stands out, other performers such as Burl Ives, Julie Harris and Jo Van Fleet are equally fine.

results.title: East meets West
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Monitor”.
A musical encounter uniting European and Indian music in a session of improvisation. Famous English guitarist Julian Bream is accompanied by Alla Rakha playing the Tabla and Ali Akbar Khan, a virtuoso of the Indian sarod - a four stringed instrument similar to the lute. Note: ‘East West Encounter’ appears at the end of the film.

group_siblings.title: The Class
group_siblings.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Huw Wheldon and John Schlesinger

results.title: East meets West
results.brief_description: West is a theatre company made up of actors, musicians and directors. In this program, the members of the company are working together with a Melbourne Vietnamese community and have devised a play which is intended as a welcome to Vietnamese immigrants in Australia. Scenes from rehearsals and excerpts from the performances are included.

results.title: East is east
results.creator_credit: Film Four International, Assassin Films, Leslee Udwin and Damien O'Donnell
results.brief_description: Set in a small town in the north of England in 1971 this comedy/drama focuses on the inter-generational and cross-cultural conflicts in a large Anglo-Pakistani family. Patriarch George Kahn’s attempts to instill traditional Pakistani values in his seven young adult children are constantly thwarted— both by his easy going British wife and the siblings’ own ambitions. In their claustrophobically cramped terrace house, anarchy erupts daily with farcical energy. The film takes a more serious turn when Kahn decides to set up arranged marriages for his eldest sons. The fierce resistance he faces from his children and their deep resentment at the fact that he has never acknowledged the reality of their lives force him to confront his own chauvinist nature. Cast includes Om Puri and Linda Bassett.

results.title: East Germany: beyond the Wall
results.creator_credit: Columbia Broadcasting System Television, Edward Magruder Jones and Palmer Williams
results.brief_description: Life in East Germany. The influence of the Communist Party on home life, work, churches and schools. Includes interviews with a capitalistic businessman, a pastor, an official of Rostock University and Walter Ulbricht, Chairman of East Germany’s Council of State.
